page.title: 06Landscape-Caerhays estate
page.content: The estate of Caerhays extends to nearly 3000 acres and in includes Caerhays Castle and its grounds with 2 lodges,the village of Caerhays and several farms.The village has a old farmhouse,12 cottages,a village hall and the church of St.Micheal.There is also a small school which is now closed and surrounded by brambles and weeds.Many people are employed to look after the estate encluding a farm manger,estate manger,shephards, gardeners and secretaries.The gardens of the castle are open at Easter and Whitsun.About 2500 people come to see the the rhodedendrons and the camelias for which Caerhays is famous,and the money to the local charities.The presant owner's grandfather John Charles Williams was distinguished gardener and raised several varieties of Camelia which bear the family name
